bill_title: prohibit recovery based on claims resulting from weight gain, obesity, or a health condition resulting from long-term consumption of a qualified product.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit recovery based on claims resulting from weight gain, obesity, or any health conditions relating to weight gain, obesity, or cumulative consumption. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Claim," any claim asserted by or on behalf of any person on whose weight gain, obesity, or health condition the claim is based; any person other than the person on whose weight gain, obesity, or health condition the claim is based; and any derivative claim made by or on behalf of any person or any representative, spouse, parent, child, or other relative of any person; (2) "Cumulative consumption," with respect to a health condition, any health condition that increases in severity in whole or in part because of the successive consumption of a qualified product, including increased cholesterol, heart disease, and high blood pressure; (3) "Engaged in business," manufacturing, marketing, distributing, advertising, or selling a qualified product in the regular course of trade or business; (4) "Livestock," cattle, bison swine, sheep, goats, horses, ratites, and captive cervidae; (5) "Livestock producer," any producer of livestock; (6) "Manufacturer," any person who is lawfully engaged in the business of manufacturing a qualified product; (7) "Qualified product," any food or drink as defined in section 201(f) of the Federal Food Drug and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. § 321(f)) and specifically including meat and meat products from livestock; (8) "Qualified product producer," any livestock producer, manufacturer, seller, or trade association; (9) "Seller," any person lawfully engaged in the business of marketing, distributing, advertising, or selling a qualified product; (10) "Trade association," any association or business organization that is not operated for profit, if two or more members are manufacturers, marketers, distributors, livestock producers, advertisers, or sellers of a qualified product. Section 2. No qualified product producer is liable on any claim for damages, penalties, declaratory judgment, injunctive or declaratory relief, restitution, or other relief arising out of, resulting from, or related to injury from the consumption of a qualified product and weight gain, obesity, or any health condition that is related to weight gain, obesity, or cumulative consumption. Section 3. Nothing in section 2 of this Act prevents or limits the liability of any qualified producer in an action: (1) In which a qualified product producer knowingly and willfully violated a federal or state statute applicable to the manufacturing, marketing, distribution, advertisement, labeling, or sale of the product if the violation was a proximate cause of the injury resulting from a person's weight gain, obesity, or health condition associated with weight gain, obesity, or cumulative consumption; (2) For breach of express contract or express warranty in connection with the purchase of a qualified product; or (3) Regarding the sale of a qualified product which is in material violation of an adulteration or misbranding requirement prescribed by statute, rule or regulation and if the claimed injury was directly caused by such violation. Section 4. Any party that prevails on a motion to dismiss under section 2 of this Act may recover reasonable attorney's fees and costs incurred in connection with the motion to dismiss. Section 5. This Act may be cited as the Commonsense Consumption Act.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit recovery based on claims resulting from weight gain, obesity, or a health condition resulting from long-term consumption of a qualified product. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. Terms used in this Act mean: (1) "Livestock," cattle, bison, swine, sheep, goats, horses, ratites, and captive cervidae; (2) "Livestock producer," any producer of livestock; (3) "Long-term consumption," the cumulative effect of the consumption of any qualified product and not the effect of a single instance of consumption; (4) "Qualified product," any food or drink as defined in section 201(f) of the Federal Food Drug and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. § 321(f)), in effect as of January 1, 2004, and specifically including meat and meat products from livestock; (5) "Seller," any person or entity lawfully engaged in the business of marketing, distributing, advertising, or selling a qualified product; (6) "Trade association," any association or business organization that is not operated for profit, if two or more members are manufacturers, marketers, distributors, livestock producers, advertisers, or sellers of a qualified product. Section 2. No manufacturer, seller, trade association, livestock producer, or retailer of a qualified product is subject to civil liability for injury or death in any case in which liability is based on the individual's weight gain, obesity, or a health condition related to weight gain or obesity, and the weight gain, obesity, or health condition results from the individual's long-term consumption of a qualified product. Section 3. Any civil action regarding a claim as set forth in section 2 of this Act that is governed by the laws of South Dakota and that is pending on the date of the enactment of this Act shall be subject to the terms of this Act. Section 4. This Act may be cited as the Commonsense Consumption Act.
